revised_title: A Study of Flocculence Variants in a Single Cell Culture of Saccharomyces cerevisiae
tldr: The author studied a single cell culture of a strain of Saccharomyces cerevisiae and observed that it became less flocculent during subculture. They discovered that the culture contained a mixture of variants with different degrees of flocculence. By examining sedimentation times, the author found that some variants gave rise to other variants during subculture, and the proportion of less flocculent yeast increased over time. This study provides insights into the genetic and physical properties of yeast and their impact on flocculence.
